xml.name: Quick Fixes and intentions
xml.Text: shows all the same fix-its for your Swift code, as Xcode does.
xml.Try: Press ShowIntentionActions and select Apply Fix-it to replace unused variable with _

Moreover, AppCode integrates SourceKit as a separate inspection, that means you can run it on the whole file and fix all the problems at once if several fix-its are available. Press CodeInspection.OnEditor.
xml.Text: As you see, we have three problems in our code: two warnings and one error. Select Swift â†’ SourceKit inspections, press ShowIntentionActions and select Apply Fix-it (or click the button with the same name on the right) - all the problems should be corrected.
xml.Try: Now press EditorEscape to return to the editor window and then press ShowIntentionActions on the incorrectly spelled variable name. Select Type: Rename to..., choose the correct variant and press EditorEnter
Note, how only the needed part was corrected and all variable usages were automatically renamed. Now repeat the same actions twice to fix the incorrctlySpeled string.
Press GotoNextError to go to the next error
Error handling intentions help adding try/catch/throws where needed. Press ShowIntentionActions and select one of the quick-fixes.
Press GotoNextError to go to the next warning
You can remove redundant @objc attributes - press ShowIntentionActions and select Remove redundant attribute @objc
If need to add or remove explicit type to some variable, simply press ShowIntentionActions and select Add/Remove explicit type. Try it now with the fileManager variable
